name: Hotel Lancaster

reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at The Lancaster Hotel in Paris for four nights in May, 2006. Although listed as 4-star it will one day be 5-star.

reviews.title: Sketchy Charges
reviews.text: From when we were greeted by the doorman the service was personal and first class. The Front desk was helpful and polite and they spoke about half a dozen languages fluently. We arranged taxi's and tours through the concierge without flaw.

The location was very good for us, a few steps from the Champs and Arche de Triomphe. The local restaurants are overpriced and food not so good but if you take the metro to a less-touristy location you will find much better value (for example, the restaurants by The Opera were better).
reviews.title: Dreadful in Every Possible Sense
Paper thin walls
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was nice, although pricey - it's Paris !

reviews.title: Stealth wealth!
reviews.text: We did have dinner one night in the Hotel and it was exceptional and five star. It was pricey but we wanted a special night to remember and the service and quality of food was just that - special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviwers have said, this is a beautiful hotel with attentive service and excellent food. However, be warned about the level of noise from the street at weekends; I was woken two or three times during the night by drivers "leaning" on their car horns (in typical French fashion!). It would seem this road is a cut through off the CE and does get very congested. There is also a nightclub two or three doors down which didn't help. The rooms do have double windows but these were not sufficient.
reviews.title: Beautiful with a big but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please DO stay here, but ensure you get a room at the back overlooking the pretty courtyard
reviews.title: Loved the Lancaster

likes.liked: — the quiet elegance for the price

reviews.text: Wife and I stayed 2 nights at Lancaster early May. Location is just off Champs-Elyssee below Arc de Triumph. Is a LHW hotel . We had a Jr suite that was very large and well furnished. Service was attentive. The food for breakfast and dinner was wonderful. Also had fitness room we used and enjoyed. For quiet,classical ambience in 8th Arr this is hard to beat.
reviews.title: Another Underwhelming Paris Hotel

reviews.text: The good: Hotel Lancaster has a great location, right off CE, near many good restaurants and bars. Lovely common area. Friendly staff. Free internet use. DVD in room. Clean bathrooms.
reviews.title: Short but sweet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad: the standard rooms are really small. Being an old hotel, the sound proof is terrible. I could hear all kinds of noisy from upstairs at night. I am a light sleeper so this is really agitating. The room is really cold and i was told to turn off air conditioning completely to solve the problem. Yikes.
reviews.title: excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a wonderful long weeked in Paris staying at the Lancaster for the first time. Just perfect, the staff couldn't have been more courteous and friendly. Perfect location, just off the Champs Elyees. The decor is very elegant and typical high society French in style. The bed was to my liking, firm and crisp white sheets. The food was truly the best I have experienced in a very long time. Attaining a decent cup of tea in France can be a real effort, however, once requested a particular method, we were more than satisfied each morning. Would we return to this hotel, without a dout.
reviews.title: Super Hotel

likes.liked: — Good clean firm bed. Friendly, helpful staff.

reviews.text: The location of this quiet hotel is perfection- only one block from Fauboug St Honore and one block from the Avenue George V. Nonetheless it is quiet and somewhat removed from the tackiness of the Champs.My room (40) was huge and beautifully decorated - bed linens were lovely and the bed itself was firm. Standard of housekeeping was excellent and I found the staff to be extremely courteous and obliging, ( in fact they were fun) particularly the concierge desk which made reservations for us all over town with no problem and which offered their own helpful suggestions. The crowd at the hotel is nice - lots of brits and italians, unlike the louche group at the Plaza Athenee. This hotel has more of a Venetian look to it than other hotels similarly priced - the colors are faded and tasteful, not loud and bright, - and for the price gives excellent value for money. In fact the word 'gloomy' comes to mind in describing the bar area but 'tasteful gloomy' - lots of ochre, deep reds and mauve - very hip, with a nice outdoor bar. Breakfasts were copious and very tasty and the coffee was excellent thankfully - the restaurant here becomes the kitchen of famed chef Michel Troisgros at night and I regret not having taken more meals here. No wonder Marlene Dietrich chose this place to live towards the end of her life. A hip, delightful home in Paris.
reviews.title: Splendor and Graciousness at the Lancaster

likes.liked: — room size and decor was terrific and staff was excellent
likes.disliked: — decor in front hall and lobby needs helop

reviews.text: If you are seeking extreme Parisian arrogance with an inflated sense of self importance, trading off past glories....welcome to The Lancaster!
reviews.title: Arrogant Faded Glory!
Super chic Hotel great location
reviews.text: Unfortunately the past negative reviews are all true! especially "Rude snobbish staff" and "17th century rooms at 21st century prices"

I was prepared to overlook the tired decor of the "Prestige" room, the 30 year old lighting and a television worthy of a road-side motel. I was even prepared to overlook the poor quality and expensive (30 euros) wireless internet and the cigarette burns on the furniture. However, the behaviour of the Matre'D and her staff in the restaurant was unforgiveable.
reviews.title: Love the Lancaster

likes.liked: — The elegance of a true small palace hotel.
likes.disliked: — Would prefer all hotels eleminate bath tubs and just have showers. Tubs are totally a thing of the past.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was truly shocked to read the Aug 12th review that spoke of an arrogant manager and ghosts on the premises. We have just returned from our one week stay at the Lancaster, which overlapped with this guest. I have stayed in many, many hotels in Paris, and I can say with confidence that we had a marvelous visit at the Lancaster that would be difficult to surpass. This is an elegant, some what old school hotel, with an updated lobby area. Upon arrival we were delighted to discover when we were shown to our room that we had been upgraded to a Prestige room, which included a fireplace, at no extra charge. While the room was indeed on the street side, it was not noisy by city standards. The room was large and well decorated in a style that would be more faded elegance than shiny chain. The service was superb, the staff gracious and helpful at every turn. Breakfast was delicious, if rather over priced at 35 euros each. While personaly I'm not keen on the location in the 8th -- for this reason my favorite hotel in Paris remains the left bank L'Hotel-- the Hotel Lancaster is indeed a truly gracious and very parisian hotel that I would happily stay at again and highly recommend.
reviews.title: Gracious Elegance

likes.liked: — Very gracious staff, elegant decor, large room.

reviews.text: we share the same experiences like other reviewers who had terrible experiences and bad treatment at Lancaster. Noise from overall directions (street and other rooms) due to the poor sound insulation and run down hotel conditions. The manager is arrogant and hostile. The room rate is the same as the rate charged by some of the five star hotels in Paris but the hotel only provides 1 star services in addition, as a light sleeper, i can feel the ghost haunt during the night. the room is big but not practical and useless it seems the space is provided to house their own old furniture and "owners of mansion" as we can feel the ghost haunt during the night.
reviews.title: Terribel hotel with terrible rates

reviews.text: I was at the Lancaster for only one night in early July. The rooms are tiny and expensive, but this is standard for Paris. The standard room was fine for me, one person, but I could see how it could be cramped for two. Hotel (although not the block it is on) is beautiful. I had a room that faced the inner courtyard and prescription sleeping pills so noise was not an issue at all, but the soundproofing is as one would expect from an 18th century building. The staff was above and beyond my expectations. The decor was excellent. The lunch I had at the hotel restaurant was in the top five meals I've had in my life. I find this area (8th arron.) a bit sterile for my taste (Champs Elysee is a bit too much like the upscale shopping district near where I live) but I still found lots to like nearby.
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lancaster is a great hotel; beautiful rooms, amazing staff, nice amenities. However, if you get one of their rooms that face the street, be prepared for hearing a great deal of noise all night long. Unfortunately, there are few rooms which do not face the street. I am not sure why a hotel this luxurious, that is trying to cater to an upscale clientel, would not invest in better sound proofing. I had read many of the previous reviews that stated this was a problem but was not concerned because we are heavy sleepers. We were constantly awoken each night to loud sounds from the street, or one night we could hear the people upstairs arguing at 3 in the morning. Lancaster, listen to what the reviewrs are saying!! I would not return here for fear of being placed in a street room again. This is a shame because it is a 5 star hotel in every other way. If you go, make sure your room doesn't face the street, or that you are a very heavy sleeper.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-too much noise

likes.disliked: — Loud noises make sleep very difficult

reviews.title: Lancaster
reviews.text: I guess I could sum it up by saying I'll go elsewhere next time in Paris. The location is good. The staff is very helpful. The restaurant is first class

description: 57 rooms & suites appointed with antique furniture surround a Zen-inspired patio that is a natural complement to the art that pervades the property and the cuisine at its Michelin-rated "La Table du Lancaster".The paintings at this century-old, boutique hotel located on the Champs Elysees are distinguishable from the acquired art lining many European hotels, as they were done by the hotel’s artist-in-residence inthe 1930s, Russian painter Boris Pastoukhoff.
